title: No, Saudi Arabian Crown Prince hasn’t threatened to convert all the Hindus in his country to Muslims
subtitle: ﻿Saudi Arabia Crown Prince Salman hasn’t made any such comments. Information from no credible source was found to authenticate the claim.
author: factly.in
vclaim:
On Facebook, a post is being shared alleging that Saudi Arabia Crown Prince Mohammed Bin Salman has threatened that if Muslims in India are forced to say ‘Jai Sri Ram’, then he would convert all the Hindus in his country to Muslims and also cancel their visas. Let’s try to analyze the claims made in the post.

Claim: Saudi Arabia Crown Prince Mohammed Bin Salman has threatened that if Muslims in India are forced to say ‘Jai Sri Ram’, then he would convert all the Hindus in his country to Muslims and also cancel their visas. Fact: Saudi Arabia Crown Prince Salman hasn’t made any such comments. Information from no credible source was found to authenticate the claim. Hence the claim made in the post is FALSE .

When Googled if Saudi Arabia Crown Prince has made any comments as alleged in the post, no relevant information was found. If Prince Salman has made any such bizarre remarks, it would have been reported by all the major newspapers in India and also in Saudi Arabia. But nothing concrete was found on the internet to solidify the claim. It was also checked if he had posted any such news on any of the social media platforms, it was found that he doesn’t have any Facebook or Twitter accounts.

Finally, Saudi Arabian Crown Prince hasn’t threatened to convert all the Hindus in his country to Muslims and also cancel their visas if Indian Muslims are forced to say ‘Jai Sri Ram’ slogans.
